Posts.Content: Hello everyone. I am totally new to this. Let me go ahead and tell you my story. For the year I been having pain in my penis area and some discomfort when sitting. I had a PSA done last year, on 09/2016 and it was 0.38. Had a urinalysis done and checked for STDs, all were negative. I had another PSA done on 08/2017 and it was 0.34. The pain continued and so I went to a new doctor who referred for a ultrasound of my bladder and prostate despite having a normal Digital rectal exam. On the Ultrasound, the radiologist said he saw a 2 cm hypoechoic area, either abscess or tumor. So I went to the urologist, who performed another digital rectal Exam and said it felt normal and said he recommends the MRI. I have been freaking out and self diagnosed myself with Prostate cancer. The urologist doesnt think it is cancer, but what else can it be if its not cancer. My prostate total volume is 6 cc by the way. Any words of advise and encouragement is greatly appreciated.
Posts.Title: 37 year old - 2 cm nodule

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by cdtechman Read my post on my MRI. I had 3T with endocoil. https://www.cancerforums.net/threads...ears-old/page3 Like you they found a 1cm lesion. I am also worried. I have no symptoms other then high psa. Did they find the lesion with the MRI? Hopefully its nothing bad. I am really scared about all this. Did ur urologist say what it can be?
Posts.Title: 37 year old - 2 cm nodule

Posts.Content: Hi Chuck.. I really appreciate the words of encouragement and will be getting the MRI Next week. I have been freaking myself out with google and only pick out the worse things. I am really hoping for it to be an abscess or something other than cancer. I will keep u informed and up to date with my progress. Thanks Ruben (Nebur)
Posts.Title: 37 year old - 2 cm nodule

Posts.Content: Thanks guys - but Im just worried and scared because 2 cm seems pretty big. On the positives i do have a low PSA and small prostate , but the nodule just freaks me out and has me all worked up. My MRI is on Friday and Im really scared. But Im glad I found this forum, knowing Im not alone in this. - Ruben

Posts.Content: Thanks for responding LastChance.. just curious if your friend ended up having had PCA or something else. I am assuming, my next step would be biopsy to either eliminate or confirm if whatever it is they think they saw is positive. Only symptom I have is pain in my penis area, not all day, but just an annoying pain. I have normal urine flow and once in a while have pain while urinating. My UA was negative and all STDs negative. PSA writhin normal range.
Posts.Title: Additional MRI Images - so scared now

Posts.Content: A few months ago I had a Ultrasound done on me because I have been having a ongoing pain in my penis area for almost a year now and some mild discomfort Im assuming my prostate area, usually when I sit for prolonged periods. I had a PSA done on me back in 10/16 and it came out to be 0.38 ng. Had multiple STD tests, all negative. Continued to have pain / discomfort, so i had another PSA done in 08/17 and the results came back as 0.34 ng. I am 37 years old by the way. I then had Ultrasound done in September. My prostate is pretty small at only 6 cc volume. The Ultrasound came back stating a 2 cm hypoechoic neoplasm That may be an abscess and requested for a MRI or biopsy. The urologist suggested the MRI and scheduled it in December but wasnt able to do it until just recently. I had the MRI done on 01/23/18 and just today (02/02/1 the radiology department called me because they wanted more Images in the Sagittal view. I am now really freaking out and thinking the worse of the worse and thinking maybe they wanted Images because they found cancer !! Im so scared and dont know what to think.. have any of you had a call for additional MRI Images? Any information would greatly be appreciated or similar experiences be shared with me. Is it possible that it is worse than though, this the reason they want more Images. Could this be a Prostatitis, cyst? Or the big C word that has metastasized, thus more Images required.

AgeInfo.Phrase: <Z> <Z> <Z> I am 37 years old by the way

Posts.Title: Additional MRI Images - so scared now

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by KPINOTT I'm very surprised that you are even considering prostate cancer here. Look up chronic pelvic pain syndrome online. You likely have that and don't have Pca with your age, no symptoms, and extraordinarily low psa. You are totally overreacting. Im just very concerned because of the nodule they found on Ultrasound and then I had a MRI last week and then the radiology department called me yesterday to have additional images done. I am now in total panic mode. I did consider CPPS.. but Im not sure if nodules are present with this. On the positives, I am relatively young for PCA and have low PSA with a small prostate according to my labs and ultrasound images. But I am now thinking the worse of the worse. Havent been able to sleep or enjoy myself the past few days and weeks since this.
Posts.Title: Additional MRI Images - so scared now

Posts.Content: anyone here ever have a 2 cm or Similar in size prostate nodule that was benign ? Really worried
